name: Old Zoo
description: An abandoned zoo situated in Gotham City, serving as the hideout for The Penguin in 'Batman Returns'.

content.title: History
content.body: The Old Zoo in Gotham City was once a bustling attraction, but it has long been abandoned by the time of the events in 'Batman Returns'. Once a place filled with visitors marveling at exotic animals, it has since fallen into decay, becoming a haven for various nefarious activities. In the movie, it is notably used as a hideout by The Penguin.

content.title: Geography
content.body: The Old Zoo is situated within Gotham City, a fictional metropolis known for its towering skyscrapers and Gothic architecture. The zoo itself is characterized by its dilapidated enclosures, overgrown pathways, and a cold, eerie atmosphere that permeates the area.

content.title: Notable Features
content.body:
The Old Zoo includes several key landmarks:
- **The Penguin's Lair**: Deep within the zoo, The Penguin establishes his base of operations, complete with an army of penguins and his criminal associates.
- **Penguin Pool**: A remodeled pool that serves as a meeting place and hiding spot for The Penguin and his minions.
- **Crumbling Enclosures**: The remnants of animal habitats now used for storage and secret meetings.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: The Old Zoo is significant to the narrative of 'Batman Returns' as it is where The Penguin schemes against Gotham City and launches his attacks. It serves as a central location for several pivotal scenes, reflecting the character's outcast nature and his connection to the animal world.
